newsitem.title: USA: Foamex unit to repurchase public debt. [CORRECTED 3:08 GMT 13/5]
newsitem.headline: Foamex unit to repurchase public debt. [CORRECTED 3:08 GMT 13/5]

text.p: Foamex International Inc said on Monday that it's subsidiary, Foamex L.P., had commenced tender offers with concurrent consent solicitations for a total of $489.7 million of aggregate principal of public debt with an aim to reduce the company's interest expense.
The consent solicitations will expire on May 23 and the tender offers will expire on June 9, the company said.
The company said that it expects to fund the repurchase with the proceeds of a $480.0 million Foamex L.P. credit facility, a $150 million senior notes offering and cash.

Marshall Cogan, the company's chairman and chief executive, said that as a result of its refinancing activities, Foamex International expects to achieve annualized interest expense savings of between $8.0 million and $11.0 million.

The company added that it also expects to take a one-time pre-tax charge of between $41.0 million and $47.0 million in the second quarter of 1997. (Corrects to show that charge is pre-tax, not net of tax).
The charge will be related to the early extinguishment of debt, the write-off of debt issuance costs and additional one-time charges related to other aspects of the refinancing, it said.
Foamex expects to complete its refinancing activities by the end of the second quarter of 1997.
Donaldson, Lufkin and Jenrette Securities Corp is acting as the dealer manager for the tender offers and the consent solicitations, the company added.
Foamex is a manufacturer and marketer of flexible polyurethane and advanced polymer foam products.
